reviews.title: Probably just a one-off bad experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked out after one night due to what I believe is a one-off bad experience. We came back late after a movie and discovered our things were covered with baby spiders! Our theory is that some eggs hatched while we were out. We spent the night killing them and cleaning our bags out. The next morning, we saw a few stranglers over our things so we decided to check out.
reviews.title: Blessing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose to approach the owner discreetly downstairs (and waited for other guests to be out of earshot). She told us we should have rang for her in the middle of the night and that she wanted to see what they looked like. We told her they were NOT bed bugs (they were white in colour, very tiny like minute ants, not black). We asked for a reduction in the room rate and she said no. She offered to change our room. She kinda made us feel bad for leaving because we reserved 3 nights, but I hate bugs so I had to leave. We checked into Ginger (a business oriented, modern hotel) which was more expensive but gave us the peace of mind needed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really think this is a one-off, bad luck, chance of nature occurrence. The guest house is quite cute and in a nice area. I wish we could have stayed there longer and that she would have done right by discounting the room given that we spent the night cleaning spiders from our stuff.
reviews.title: Charming, spotless, friendly owners, great location

reviews.text: What a great experience it was to stay at Afonso Guest House! After 4 months traveling around South East Asia and India, all my boyfriend and I wanted to do was stay at a nice place, relax and enjoy peacefully. And that´s what we could do here! Clifton is a very cheerful and charismatic person, always smiling and willing to help, so is the rest of his lovely family. The Guest House is a renovated house, painted in different pale colours, very cozy and quiet. It has a nice terrace for breakfast, which is not included in the price but is extra-cheap and it was my partner´s favourite, as he said.. The rooms are very clean, fan doesn´t work much, but complimentary AC for a couple of hours did the trick. It is very well located, in one of the nicest neighbourhoods we walked around while in Panaji, and walking distance from almost everywhere. Would definitely recommend this place!

reviews.text: Had a couple of nice nights in this place. Feels tucked away but the city is eminently walkable and the location keeps much of the noise away. Owners were remarkably friendly and helpful with advice about the Goa area. Nice rooftop breakfasts. Have to ring for them to turn on hot water and no tv. Get a second floor room to guarantee wifi coverage. In all, I wouldn't stay anywhere else in the city. 1200 rupees per night.
reviews.title: Quiet and Homey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A simple place, tucked away in a relatively quite corner of the city. The rooms are basic and clean. Not too bad a deal for INR 1250 a day I would say. This dint include the AC though but frankly you don't need one at this time of the year. You'll need to carry essentials like a soap and other basic toiletries.. There's no television but the complementary Wi Fi makes up for it. Sleep quality was very good, the beds are comfortable. The rooms have big windows with mesh, so good natural ventilation and no bugs. If you are looking to travel within the city or around Panjim on day trips, its a good place to form a base. Owners are quite warm and welcoming. Check out time of 0900 is a bit odd and can be inconvenient to some.
reviews.title: Simple, Clean and Homely...

reviews.text: We loved it here from the moment we were greeted by the owners son. All the staff are friendly, helpful and efficient. The rooms were very clean and everything worked. Wifi was good too. Plus u are 30 seconds walk to a fantastic restaurant called Viva. We eat like kings and queens and the bill would not go above 700rs even if we drank alcohol. Really recommend this place. Down a quiet pretty little side street.

reviews.text: This was one of the nicest and cosiest place I have been to in my last 3 months in Asia. Standing in the back street with a lot of trees, Afonso is a quiet and cosy place with friendly staff and tasty breakfasts served on the roof. All the amenities were great, fast internet and comfortable rooms.

reviews.text: I made an impulse trip to Goa from Delhi when I was there for business in October. I used Panjim as a base for day trips and Afonso Guest House met my needs perfectly. It was clean, the staff and owner were friendly and helpful and good value for money in comparison with other accommodation in the area. As a great added bonus, the reliable wifi connection meant that I could keep in touch with work. It's in a good, peaceful location but within easy walking distance of the centre of town and the bus station. I have no hesitation in recommending it to others.
